testcase.name: Ingest a binary item via the Python application programming interface
testcase.system-out:
@scenario.begin Scenario: Ingest a binary item via the Python application programming interface Given I have an initialized corpus at "corpus" ... passed in 0.001s When I ingest an item via the Python application programming interface into corpus "corpus" with filename "image.png" and media type "image/png" ... passed in 0.008s Then the python ingest result succeeds ... passed in 0.000s And the python ingested item has media type "image/png" ... passed in 0.000s
@scenario.end --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

testcase.name: Corpus has a stable file:// uniform resource identifier
testcase.system-out:
@scenario.begin Scenario: Corpus has a stable file:// uniform resource identifier Given I have an initialized corpus at "corpus" ... passed in 0.001s When I open the corpus via the Python application programming interface at "corpus" ... passed in 0.000s Then the corpus uniform resource identifier starts with "file://" ... passed in 0.000s
@scenario.end --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

testcase.name: Ingest a Portable Document Format file without extension has a usable filename and sidecar media type
testcase.system-out:
@scenario.begin Scenario: Ingest a Portable Document Format file without extension has a usable filename and sidecar media type Given I have an initialized corpus at "corpus" ... passed in 0.014s When I ingest an item via the Python application programming interface into corpus "corpus" with filename "paper" and media type "application/pdf" ... passed in 0.002s Then the python ingest result succeeds ... passed in 0.000s And the python ingested item relpath ends with ".pdf" ... passed in 0.000s And the python ingested item sidecar includes media type "application/pdf" ... passed in 0.001s
@scenario.end --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

testcase.name: Ingest a markdown item without extension gets .md
testcase.system-out:
@scenario.begin Scenario: Ingest a markdown item without extension gets .md Given I have an initialized corpus at "corpus" ... passed in 0.001s When I ingest an item via the Python application programming interface into corpus "corpus" with filename "note" and media type "text/markdown" ... passed in 0.001s Then the python ingest result succeeds ... passed in 0.000s And the python ingested item relpath ends with ".md" ... passed in 0.000s
@scenario.end --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

testcase.name: Ingest an image/jpeg without extension gets .jpg
testcase.system-out:
@scenario.begin Scenario: Ingest an image/jpeg without extension gets .jpg Given I have an initialized corpus at "corpus" ... passed in 0.001s When I ingest an item via the Python application programming interface into corpus "corpus" with filename "photo" and media type "image/jpeg" ... passed in 0.001s Then the python ingest result succeeds ... passed in 0.000s And the python ingested item relpath ends with ".jpg" ... passed in 0.000s
@scenario.end --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

testcase.name: Ingest a Portable Document Format file with no filename uses a .pdf extension
testcase.system-out:
@scenario.begin Scenario: Ingest a Portable Document Format file with no filename uses a .pdf extension Given I have an initialized corpus at "corpus" ... passed in 0.001s When I ingest an item via the Python application programming interface into corpus "corpus" with no filename and media type "application/pdf" ... passed in 0.001s Then the python ingest result succeeds ... passed in 0.000s And the python ingested item relpath ends with ".pdf" ... passed in 0.000s
@scenario.end --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

testcase.name: Ingest unknown media type does not invent an extension
testcase.system-out:
@scenario.begin Scenario: Ingest unknown media type does not invent an extension Given I have an initialized corpus at "corpus" ... passed in 0.001s When I ingest an item via the Python application programming interface into corpus "corpus" with filename "mystery" and media type "application/x-biblicus-unknown" ... passed in 0.001s Then the python ingest result succeeds ... passed in 0.000s And the python ingested item relpath ends with "--mystery" ... passed in 0.000s And the python ingested item sidecar includes media type "application/x-biblicus-unknown" ... passed in 0.001s
@scenario.end --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

testcase.name: Ingest binary metadata writes through to sidecar
testcase.system-out:
@scenario.begin Scenario: Ingest binary metadata writes through to sidecar Given I have an initialized corpus at "corpus" ... passed in 0.001s When I ingest an item via the Python application programming interface with metadata foo "bar" into corpus "corpus" with filename "data.bin" and media type "application/octet-stream" ... passed in 0.002s Then the python ingest result succeeds ... passed in 0.000s And the python ingested item sidecar includes metadata foo "bar" ... passed in 0.001s
@scenario.end --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

testcase.name: Tags ignore blanks and non-strings from front matter
testcase.system-out:
@scenario.begin Scenario: Tags ignore blanks and non-strings from front matter Given I have an initialized corpus at "corpus" ... passed in 0.001s When I ingest a markdown item via the Python application programming interface into corpus "corpus" with front matter tags and extra tags ... passed in 0.002s Then the python ingest result succeeds ... passed in 0.000s And the python ingested item tags equal "y,x" ... passed in 0.000s
@scenario.end --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

testcase.name: Stream ingestion refuses Markdown
testcase.system-out:
@scenario.begin Scenario: Stream ingestion refuses Markdown Given I have an initialized corpus at "corpus" ... passed in 0.001s When I attempt stream ingestion of a Markdown item into corpus "corpus" ... passed in 0.000s Then the python stream ingestion error is raised ... passed in 0.000s
@scenario.end --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

testcase.name: Stream ingestion supports no filename
testcase.system-out:
@scenario.begin Scenario: Stream ingestion supports no filename Given I have an initialized corpus at "corpus" ... passed in 0.001s When I stream ingest bytes into corpus "corpus" with no filename and media type "application/pdf" ... passed in 0.002s Then the python ingest result succeeds ... passed in 0.000s And the python ingested item relpath ends with ".pdf" ... passed in 0.000s
@scenario.end --------------------------------------------------------------------------------

testcase.name: Stream ingestion writes metadata to sidecar
testcase.system-out:
@scenario.begin Scenario: Stream ingestion writes metadata to sidecar Given I have an initialized corpus at "corpus" ... passed in 0.001s When I stream ingest bytes into corpus "corpus" with filename "blob.bin" and media type "application/octet-stream" and metadata foo "bar" ... passed in 0.002s Then the python ingest result succeeds ... passed in 0.000s And the python ingested item sidecar includes metadata foo "bar" ... passed in 0.001s
@scenario.end --------------------------------------------------------------------------------
